sub_title: Front End Development manager role for green Hydrogen and LNG projects
summary:
Ph.D. (2008) and MSc in Mechanical Engineering from Ghent University (Belgium)
Ph.D. examined heat transfer and fluid flow in compact heat exchangers (air conditioning application). During my PhD I designed and performed experiments in wind and water tunnels for heat transfer, pressure drop and flow field visualization. Using these unique experimental campaigns, the thermohydraulic behaviour was studied of a novel fin geometry supported with 3D CFD simulation. 

Academic experience:
Post doctoral researcher at UGent (2009) and TU Delft (2009-2011).
- guided thesis projects at UGent, TU Delft and Shell on a range of topics
- teachers assistant for "Thermal Systems" (4 yrs) and Thermodynamics (1 yr) at UGent
- performed experiments / industrial support on heat transfer and multiphase flow: heat exchanger design, heat transfer in metal foam, natural circulation with supercritical fluids, multiphase flow splitting
- Published 50+ journal articles (1000+ citations) and 40+ conference publications

Industrial experience (from 2012 on)
Joined Shell 2/2012 as a Flow Assurance Engineer in Amsterdam, transitioned to Front End Pipelines engineer in 2016 and to LNG Regas team in 2018.
- Pipesim, Unisim and OLGA simulation experience for oil /gas wells and pipeline system for assets and projects (Upstream / Integrated Gas). Supported pre-FEED activities as well as asset support (start-up)
- Developed guidelines for low temperature simulations (Joule Thomson cooling - cold start-up, brittle fracture) - process safety
- Active slug control system design + commissioning experience (offshore)
- Coordinated R&D efforts on severe slugging, pipeline heat tracing, low temperature embrittlement and cryogenic pipelines.
- Teaching experience in Shell Courses on Flow Assurance, Process and Pipelines

Specialties: heat transfer and (multiphase) fluid flow, experimental techniques, heat exchangers, nuclear thermohydraulics, oil & gas flow modelling, process engineering and flow assurance.

awards.title: Best Overall Presentation - Early Career Track
awards.description: Presented on active heated flowlines at the MCEDD 2017 Conference evaluating the results from business cases designed for the near term Shell portfolio in deepwater oil and shallow water gas

awards.title: Best Overall Presentation - Early Career Engineer

Petroskills - Gas Conditioning and Processing - G-4
Petroskills - Production Technology for Non Production Technologists

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for technical integration and design of renewable hydrogen and LNG import projects. Leading a naturally formed (technical) project team to deliver the integrated project, spanning technical design, cost estimating, economics and risk management (TECOP). The project drive is to seek a robust solution within the TECOP spectrum of outcomes, while being competitive and affordable based on external benchmarking. Leading delivery of feasibility, design and conceptual stage up to and initiating the FEED phase. 
Example projects: renewable H2 introduction into an existing steel facility in NorthWest Germany;
profile_positions.title: Front End Development Manager Green Hydrogen and LNG

profile_positions.description: Pipeline engineer providing pre-FEED and FEED support into LNG projects (Liquefaction), CCUS (CO2 transport and gathering) and liquid H2 projects.
profile_positions.title: Pipeline Engineer - Integrated Gas and Renewable Energy Solutions

profile_positions.description: Lead Pipeline engineer for LNG Regasification covering early concept development, pre-FEED and FEED. Global portfolio covering 0.1 to 5 mtpa projects with a naval interface. Routing studies, survey preparation, geotechnical scope interfacing. Direct support to Engineering Managers as Technical integrator covering technical requirements and contractor interfaces. Technology development lead for novel technologies on LNG transfer (subsea / cryogenic hoses).
profile_positions.title: Pipeline Engineer - LNG Regas

profile_positions.description:
- Pipelines support to early projects as part of concept select and early design phases, member of an integrated team looking at surface and SURF facilities for various projects: shallow water multi-platform systems (Middle East), deepwater (Mediterranean - Malaysia) and tieback developments (North Sea, Caspian sea)
- Hydraulic design for single / multiphase pipelines - Tools: Pipesim / Unisim / OLGA... and developed calculation sheets
- Technology and Innovation support to project teams to embed technology during concept select; focused support on subsea tiebacks for external technologies
- Technology development support for heat traced pipelines: qualification workshops with Nexans and program support to deepwater projects across the globe (sizing, cost estimating, TRL review, risks and operability review)
- Low temperature studies on brittle fracture for projects and assets in operation: offshore pipelines and onshore piping systems and slugcatchers
- Supervisory role in R&D project at Imperial College on Brittle Fracture 
- Cryogenic pipeline development for small scale Regas facilities (LNG)
- Focal point for global performance monitoring of pipeline integrity and leak detection systems
profile_positions.title: Front-End pipelines Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Steady state and dynamic multiphase pipeline modelling using in-house and commercial tools (Pipesim, OLGA, Unisim Design). Projects include both front end early scoping studies, detailed design as well as asset support (operational procedure improvement). 
- PVT fluid characterisation through in-house and commercial tools (Unisim Design, PVTSIM, Multiflash)
- Overseeing large multiphase flow loop experiments (up to 5 bar air-water systems) for slug flow, multiphase flow splitting, electrical heat traced pipe-in-pipe testing and the slug to annular flow transition. Custodian of the experimental facility: responsible for maintenance, drafting of new research proposals to further the work and upgrade to the unit, student supervision
- Technology development: part of several SAT and FAT for Shell Smart Choke installations, ongoing effort to qualify new technology (e.g. heat traced Pipe-in-Pipe)
- Offshore/field experience: commissioning of Shell Smart Choke at different offshore and onshore locations 
- Key focus topic: studying cold well start-up simulations using dynamic models (OLGA and in house tools) to help design new systems and create strategies to mitigate risks at existing assets. Lead author of the new low temperature simulation guidelines.
- Heat transfer modelling: validation of existing tools - development of new models for low temperature screening.

Contributed to the Shell in house technical journal TechXplorer (4 articles) and the Pipelines, Flow Assurance and Subsea internal news letter (5 articles)
profile_positions.title: Flow Assurance Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Research on the stability of a natural circulation supercritical freon loop (DeLight facility) - test rig design, operation and conducting measurements on a novel experiment to monitor supercritical natural circulating flows. Numerical simulations using Comsol to assess the stability and examine the impact of local friction, heating and feedback loops. 

Research on the thermohydraulics of high Pr number supercritical flows (EU THINS project)

Main author of a 5 year follow up research proposal with STW on high Pr number heat transfer in annular flows with industrial partners, 2 PhD students (experimental and numerical) at TU Delft.
profile_positions.title: Post Doctoral researcher

profile_positions.description:
Post doctoral researcher on compact heat exchangers
Continuation of research proposals on heat transfer, this includes metal foams (PhD of P. De Jaeger), polymer heat exchangers, two phase flow (PdD of K. De Kerpel)...
Co-author of various research proposals and finalizing papers.
profile_positions.title: Post doctoral researcher
